back_cards.example_en: She walked to the park in the morning.
He studied hard to pass the test.

back_cards.definition_en: They sat close to the fire to keep warm.

back_cards.example_en: She gave the book to her friend.
The shop is open from nine to five.
She said that she was tired after work.
That book on the shelf is mine.
He was so tired that he fell asleep.

back_cards.definition_en: Pointing to a person or thing
back_cards.example_en: Who’s that standing by the door?
It rained so hard that the streets flooded.

back_cards.definition_en: To the same degree or extent
back_cards.example_en: She runs as fast as her brother.

back_cards.definition_en: In the role or function of
back_cards.example_en: He works as a teacher at the school.
As we walked, it started to rain.

back_cards.definition_en: In the way or manner that
back_cards.example_en: Do as I say, not as I do.
As it was late, we went home.
I need more time to finish the project.
She loves hiking more than swimming.
Can you add more sugar to the recipe?
This store has more variety than that one.
He’s getting more confident every day.
We spent the day at the beach.
Back in my day, things were different.
She has a busy day at the office.
Their wedding day was unforgettable.
Let’s meet during the day tomorrow.
One of the cookies is missing.
One should always be kind to others.
She scored one goal in the game.
He’s the one who fixed the car.
That was one amazing concert!
Her book is on the table.
I gave the gift to her yesterday.
Her smile brightened the room.
The cat hurt her paw while playing.
The ship lost her way in the storm.
The keys are over there on the counter.
We’re going there for vacation next week.
I’ve been there before, so I understand.
There is a new café downtown.
There goes the bus we missed!

back_cards.definition_en: Physically in contact with a surface
back_cards.example_en: The cup is on the table.
We’ll meet on Friday afternoon.
She wrote a book on history.
The house is on sale now.
I saw the news on TV.
No, I can’t attend the meeting today.
There’s no milk left in the fridge.
No smoking is allowed here.
No, that’s not what I meant.
He’s no friend of mine.
She’s waiting in the car.
We’ll finish the project in two weeks.
He’s in a good mood today.

back_cards.definition_en: Part of a group or activity
back_cards.example_en: She’s in the choir at school.
The letter was written in French.
When does the movie start?
I read a book when I was on vacation.
She remembers when they first met.
Why worry when you can’t change it?
We’ll leave when the rain stops.

back_cards.definition_en: In the same way or manner
back_cards.example_en: He sings as beautifully as a professional.

back_cards.definition_en: While or at the same time
back_cards.example_en: As I was leaving, the phone rang.
She volunteered as a tutor for kids.
It’s not as cold as it was yesterday.
As she was sick, she stayed home.
He walked out of the room angrily.
She’s out for lunch right now.
The new album comes out next month.
The store is out of bread.
We cleaned out the garage yesterday.
I like to read novels in the evening.
She likes coffee more than tea.
He likes working in a quiet office.
They liked the post on social media.
The kids like their new teacher.
Where did you park the car?
Where are you going this weekend?
She’s in a place where she feels happy.
That’s where we disagree.
I love the town where I grew up.
All the guests arrived on time.
All students must submit their homework.
That’s all I know about the topic.
The room was all dark and quiet.
She ate all the cake by herself.
It was so cold we stayed indoors.
Hold the brush so and paint smoothly.
He overslept, so he missed the bus.
I’m so happy you’re here!
So, what’s the plan for today?
We talked about the new movie.
It’s about ten miles from here.
There’s a park about two blocks away.
She read a book about space travel.
They wandered about the festival.
She found work at a local bakery.
There’s a lot of work to do before the event.
His work on the project was impressive.
The painting is a work of art.
I’m heading to work now.
She’s the most talented singer I know.
Most people prefer summer over winter.
It was a most enjoyable evening.
This is the most difficult puzzle yet.
Most of the food was eaten at the party.
Your answer is right.
It’s not right to lie to your friends.
She’s the right person for the job.
The car is running right after the repair.
He leans right on economic issues.
Go right to the end of the street.
You answered the question right.
I’ll call you right after the meeting.
The shop is right across the road.
Turn right at the next corner.
The bridge is a mile long.
It was a long day at work.
She has a long history with the company.
He gave a long list of demands.
The cat took a long nap on the couch.
We’ll meet after the movie ends.
She stood after him in the queue.
The dog ran after the ball.
The dish was named after a famous chef.
They asked after your health.
I enjoyed the concert so much.
There’s much to learn about history.
We don’t see them much anymore.
This bag is much heavier than that one.
It’s much the same price as before.
Only members can enter the club.
It’s only a short walk to the station.
I spoke to her only last night.
You can borrow it, only for a day.
If only I had listened to her advice!
There’s a park around the block.
The trip will take around two hours.
We sat around the campfire singing.
They looked around the market for deals.
He tied a rope around the tree.
